title: 114_hr470
content: The "Chattahoochee-Oconee National Forest Land Adjustment Act of 2015" allows for the disposal of isolated National Forest System land in Georgia to be used for more efficient purposes. Proceeds from the land sale will be used by the Forest Service to acquire land for National Forest purposes in the state. The term "Secretary" in the Act refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary is authorized to sell or exchange United States' rights in National Forest System land in Georgia. The land subject to sale or exchange consists of 30 tracts totaling 3,841 acres, depicted on maps available for public inspection. The Secretary may modify land boundaries based on management considerations. The Secretary may modify land boundaries for management purposes. Land sold under this Act will be conveyed by quitclaim deed. The Secretary may reserve rights-of-way or other interests in the land. Land cannot be sold for less than market value as determined by appraisal. Appraisals must adhere to specific standards and be approved by the Secretary. Consideration for a sale of land or equalization of an exchange shall be paid in cash. The Secretary may accept a cash equalization payment in excess of 25 percent of the value of any land exchanged. The Secretary may sell land at public or private sale, including competitive sale by auction, bid, or otherwise, in accordance with terms determined to be in the best interest of the United States. The Secretary may make public or private solicitations for the sale or exchange of land authorized by this Act. The Secretary may use brokers or third parties to sell land authorized by this Act and pay commissions from sale proceeds. The Secretary can make public or private solicitations for land sale or exchange, rejecting offers not in the public interest. SEC. 4 of the Act authorizes the Secretary to deposit sale proceeds into a specific fund for land acquisition in Georgia. The funds can be used without further appropriation for National Forest purposes, with the owner's consent required for land acquisition.
